* i have a box of aliquots in the freezer and pre heat them before use","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3b2u","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20l4s","text":"-A vial of competent cells is retrieved from storage at −80 °C and allowed to thaw on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdrqd","text":"-Plasmid DNA and electrocompetent cells are combined and gently mixed in a chilled  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"codrl","text":" 1.5-mL microcentrifuge tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fucrj","text":"-The cell–DNA suspension is transferred to a chilledelectroporation cuvette with a ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":45,"length":7,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h3fd","text":" 0.1-cm gap size.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19h","text":"-Cells are electroporated with 900V (in our Electroportor we cant set other parameters ) 
* in the Weinstock paper they recommend depending on the strain 700-900V, 25 μF and  200 Ω","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a71ks","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57dim","text":"-Cells are immediatelyrecovered in 500 μL preheated  (50°C) recovery medium and  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":11,"length":11,"style":"bold"},{"offset":42,"length":9,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83nae","text":" transferred to a 1,5-mL tube. 
 * we preheat the media to 50°C because the recovery media is cooled down by pipetting and up taking the chilled cells from the cold cuvettes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2k181","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5r712","text":"-The cells are recovered by incubating at 37 °C for 1.5h. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lah","text":" ( also put the agar plates for preheating in the incubator at 37°C )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2si5","text":"-The cells are centrifuged down for one mintute at 3000g. The supernant is then discanted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cuj4u","text":"- the pellet is resuspendet in the leftover oft he media and plated out on","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8vku","text":" warm agar plates containing appropriate antibiotic. 
* for Chloramphenicol 2µg/mL ; for Kanamycine 200µg/mL; for Carbenicillin 200µg/mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":5,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9224","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdhb6","text":"-The plates are incubated for several hours or overnight at 37 °C for colonies to appear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1i7jg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/nmeth.3970#auth-1"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/nmeth.3970#auth-2"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/nmeth.3970#auth-3"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/nmeth.3970#auth-4"}}}}
